translation: Just as the embodied soul passes through childhood, youth, and old age in this body, so too does it pass into another body; the steadfast one does not grieve over this.
commentary: 2.13 Dehinah of the embodied (soul)? in this in this? such as as? Dehe in body? Kaumaram childhood? Youth youth? Just old age? And so also? Dehantarapraptih the attaining of another body? patient the firm? There thereat? Not not? Muhyati grieves.Commentary -- Just as there is no interruption in the passing of childhood into youth and youth into old age in this body? so also there is no interruption by death
